input_text:
Job Title: Engineering Designer

Location: Orange County, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Design, Engineering, Science

Description:
Job Description

 Take Your Designing Career to the Next Level! 

Are you ready to be challenged, make a difference, and experience professional growth in your career? Kleinfelder is looking for you! Kleinfelder provides high-quality solutions to natural gas utilities and pipeline operators. You can be a part of an exciting and diverse group of professionals that are committed to being the best at what they do.

 Step into Your New Role 

We are looking for a Designer to join our team with flexibility on location to include Concord (CA), Chico (CA), Atlanta (GA), Phoenix (AZ) or Denver (CO). The Designer will prepare drawings and exhibits for design, permitting, land acquisition, operation, maintenance, and construction of natural gas distribution systems. Some typical project types are long transmission pipeline installations, retrofitting existing pipelines, transmission station design and installing or upgrading system controls, valves, and fittings. Drawing components include wiring diagrams, instrumentation, controls, electrical, grounding, foundations, component assemblies, welded assemblies, 3D facility models, and geo-referenced aerial imagery.

The Designer may be responsible to review as-built documentation for accuracy, report findings and incorporate red line as-built information into existing drawings in various formats.

Consideration for a Designer position includes the following qualifications or experience:

 Associate degree, CAD Certification  Minimum 2 years' relevant experience  Proficiency in current versions AutoCAD  Plant 3D or CAD Worx experience required  ArcGIS understanding preferred  Proficient use of MS Outlook, MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint  Must be a self-starter and work independently with conflicting deadlines  Must be able to work well in a team environment  Understanding of document control applications such as Vault and ProjectWise preferred  Produce quality drawings and provide constructive peer reviews  Utility business understanding preferred  Reading and understanding maps, plat maps, as-builts, construction drawings and gas service records for existing condition interpolation  Effective communication - written and verbal  Attention to detail and precision  Takes pride in their work 

As a Designer, you will be expected to:

 Use the latest version of CAD softwares to prepare design drawings with plan, section and detail views, isometrics, and schematics as designated by the engineering team  Prepare sketches of details not included on existing drawings to accurately reflect as-installed field conditions  Prepare drawings, forms, maps, and lists based on direction provided by lead drafters, designers and engineers  Create pipeline alignment sheets, exhibits and permit drawings used to construct pipeline projects  Visualize the project installation and provide quality control for practicality and constructability of designs  Maintain excellent project communication with continuously changing tools and processes  Provide accurate time estimates to complete assigned tasks  Complete job summary and construction notes for review by project engineers  Prepare exhibits for planning/permitting purposes  Meet required deadlines and exceed client expectations  Work closely with other workgroups at our clients' place of business and GTS offices 

 Move Forward with GTS and Kleinfelder 

Kleinfelder has been connecting great people to the best work since 1961. We are engineers, scientists, and construction professionals providing solutions that improve our clients' transportation, water, energy, and other private infrastructure. As a responsive, cross-disciplinary team of bright, curious, and innovative problem-solvers, we are dedicated to doing the right thing, every day, on every project from over 85 offices in the US, Canada, and Australia. Connecting great people to the best work is our purpose - together, we deliver.

 Progress with an Employer that Values You 

Kleinfelder is an inclusive organization free from discrimination. We are a stronger organization when we are a diverse workforce and believe that throughdiversity, equity, and inclusion comes creativity, innovation, and unity. We are proud to offer the following:

 Benefits:  Kleinfelder offers an excellent compensation and benefits package, including: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(k) plan, and paid holidays. The expected salary range for the position is displayed in accordance with the California and Colorado Pay Transparency Law. Final agreed upon compensation is based upon individual qualifications and experience. Hourly range: $21.84 - 38.23.

 Career Development:  We are committed to investing in the professional development of our staff, offering each employee every opportunity to grow, develop, and take control of their career paths. We support these efforts through reimbursements for continuing education as well as many of the expenses associated with trainings and certifications, and opportunities for career development through our internal Mentoring Program.

 Equal Opportunity:  Kleinfelder is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Women/Disabled/Veterans. (Compliant with the new VEVRAA and Section 503 rules)

 NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES 

Please note that Kleinfelder does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, Kleinfelder will not consider or agree to payment for any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, Kleinfelder explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resume, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Kleinfelder.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

output_json.title: Engineering Designer
output_json.summary: Kleinfelder is seeking a Designer to join their team with flexibility on location.
job_responsibilities: Prepare drawings, forms, maps, and lists
output_json.company_information: Kleinfelder connects great people to the best work since 1961, offering solutions for transportation, water, energy, and private infrastructure.
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: Kleinfelder is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Women/Disabled/Veterans.

Investment in professional development, continuing education, trainings, certifications, and internal mentoring program.
Compliant with California and Colorado Pay Transparency Law.
